name: The First Flash Quiz | DC Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what year did Jay Garrick first appear?
questions.explanation:
1940.

	Jay Garrick first appeared in "Flash Comics" #1 in 1940. He was not a character used by DC Comics at that point, but was instead used by All-American Publications, which would merge with two other companies to form DC Comics.

questions.text: What was Jay's occupation when we first met him?
questions.explanation:
College Student.

	Jay gained his powers through the use of heavy water vapors, which he inhaled when he fell asleep in his laboratory. Upon waking, he found he could move at superhuman speed!

questions.text: How did Jay protect his identity when fighting crime?
questions.correct: Vibrating so nobody could see his face
questions.explanation:
Vibrating so nobody could see his face.

	While in the public eye, Jay vibrates his body so that nobody can get a clear look at his face. This also foils people who try to take photographs.

questions.text: As the Flash, Jay was a founding member of which superhero group?
questions.explanation:
The Justice Society of America.

	Not only did Jay help start the JSA, he also became its first chairman! Presently he is one of three original members who serves regularly with the JSA.

questions.text: As part of his costume, Jay wears a helmet. Who did the helmet originally belong to?
options: He bought it at a costume store
questions.explanation:
Jay's father.

	The famous metal helmet with wings on it belonged to Jay's father Joseph, who perished in the first World War. Jay was only ten at the time, and the helmet is one of the only things Jay has left to remember his father by.

Joan Allen.

	Joan and Jay married in the 50's and are still married today, but they have no children. They are, however, guardians of Bart Allen, one of the youngest super-speedsters.

Barry Allen.

	In 1961, Flash met Flash when Earth-1's Flash, Barry Allen, met Earth-2's Flash. In addition, there was Earth-3, where the Crime Syndicate of America lived, and Earth-X, where one could find the Human Bomb and Uncle Sam.

questions.text: Which city was Jay based in pre-Crisis?
questions.explanation:
Keystone City.

	Keystone City, after the Crisis, was situated right across the river from Central City, which Barry Allen protected. Keystone City has been described as "blue-collar" and a center of industry.

questions.text: Jay has never served as the chairman for the Justice League.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Read the question carefully! Jay has never served as chairman for the Justice League, but he HAS served as chairman for the Justice Society. In fact, he was the team's very first chairman!

questions.text: Although he is in his eighties, Jay has the appearance and physique of someone in his late 40's. Although this has been in part to magic, what else has retarded Jay's aging?
questions.explanation:
The Speed Force.

	The Speed Force has somehow kept Jay very young for his age, although he cannot tap into it as Wally West and Bart Allen can.
